title: Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series
description:
Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series (VAHS  MTB) is Virginia’s official interscholastic mountain bike race series. Sanctioned by USA Cycling, VAHS MTB offers competitive racing for riders of all ability levels. The series is open to ANY high school, middle school, or elementary school student.

The Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series is held under USA Cycling Permit and is open to any elementary, middle or high school student in the Commonwealth. Each event has separate Elementary School (ages 9 & over), Middle School, J.V. and Varsity races both girls and boys. Most races are on primarily single-track trails and are multiple-lap events to provide a spectator-friendly experience for coaches and parents. Racers do NOT need to be on a school team to participate nor do racers need to have any race experience.VASH MTB Series is open to public school, independent school, and home school students.

The VAHS MTB Series provides a professional and enjoyable interscholastic racing experience for competitors and spectators. For those new to racing, it is an ideal introduction to mountain bike racing. If you like to mountain bike and are considering racing, this is your chance. Sign up for a race! You will have a blast!
course: All five venues feature fun and challenging courses with laps ranging from three to five miles in length.
registration:
Pre-Registration is available on BikeReg:

https://www.bikereg.com/vahsmtb2016

Day-of registration is also available on site.

title: Training and Racing with a Power Meter Camp - Bedford, VA
Natural Bridge Cycling Challenge
description: A Gran Fondo- style cycling epic from the folks behind the Tour of Virginia Pro/Am race, the NBCC will utilize many of the same roads that this internationally-known stage race frequented in historic and scenic Rockbridge County. Lexington, Vesuvius, the Blue Ridge Parkway, Buena Vista and Natural Bridge Station will all fall beneath the wheels of those who choose to take up the challenge. Join us for the 31, 63 or 94-mile routes of what is sure to become another enduring Virginia classic!
course: Routes of 94, 63 and 26 miles are offered. Longest route (Gran Fondo) has one significant Category 1 climb. Other courses are hilly but without categorized climbs.
registration: Registration my be accomplished online at www.sport-vista.com. On-site registration will be available Apr. 30 5-9 pm and May 1st 6:30 - 6:30 am. Late fee applies
notes:
The Natural Bridge Cycling Challenge is a ride, not a race. However, it will include a mass start, and is subject to some specific regulations under the permit granted by USA Cycling.

All participants must wear a helmet

Bicycles may not have motors or wind fairings attached

No trailers of any kind are allowed

All handlebar ends must be appropriately covered or plugged

Tandems and recumbent bicycles are allowed; however riders of these bicycle types will be separately grouped at the start line

During the registration process, you will be asked to provide your USA Cycling Road Racing Category, if you possess a USAC license. You do not need to possess a USA Cycling license to participate; but we will be lining up riders by experience/ability level.
directions:
The Natural Bridge is located just off Exit 175 on I-81 in Virginia between Lexington, VA and Roanoke, VA.

Exit 180 also takes you to Natural Bridge, but takes you 3.7 miles through the town of Natural Bridge, VA.

Exit 175 is a more direct route off I-81.

title: Jamestown Gran Fondo
description:
The Jamestown Gran Fondo is ideally situated in the heart of Virginia’s Historic Triangle. This beautiful ride rapidly takes you on to low traffic, country roads where the pavement is nice and the hills are small. After finishing everyone can enjoy BBQ and beer by the finish line next to the Jamestown Settlement. Don’t miss out on this wonderful time of year to be in Williamsburg, VA.

The Jamestown Gran Fondo has Century, Metric Century and 30 mile options. Each distance is fully supported with mechanics and well stocked aid stations. All routes will start at 7:30am, Each of these rides are mostly flat with some long, gradual climbs (max 125 ft). The post ride party starts at 10am and goes until 4pm. Riders get 2 beers and a BBQ plate with their entry with more available for purchase.

All registered cyclists get the following: Finishers gift, short sleeve Tri-Blend Crew shirt, custom ride socks, well supported and well stocked stations on the route and access to the post ride party

title: The Chesapeake Criterium and Virginia Senior State
2016 Air Force Association Cycling Classic-Challenge Ride
Gran Fondo Alleghany
description: No need to cross the Atlantic for an Old World cycling experience - come to Virginia's scenic Alleghany Highlands region for the sixth annual Gran Fondo Alleghany Highlands. Easily accessible from Interstate 64, and four hours' drive from both Washington, DC and Charlotte, the Alleghany Highlands' majestic peaks and picturesque valleys might be mistaken for a region of France or Germany. With electronic chip timing, a King of the Mountains competition, and a mass start, all the elements of the classic European Gran Fondo will be here stateside and served up with southern hospitality. No Michelin guide required!
directions:
From I-64, take Exit 14, VA-154, toward Covington/Hot Springs. At
the end of the ramp, make a left onto VA-154 North (S. Craig St.).
After 1.2 miles, make a right onto W. Locust St. Take the second
left onto N. Lexington Av. Then, take the first right onto Main St.
The Covington Farmer’s Market is at the end of the block, just across
from the intersection with Monroe Av. There is on-street parking as well.

title: Jackson River Road Rally
description:
The new Jackson River Road Rally is a fun ride through the scenic terrain surrounding Lake Moomaw, 15 miles north of Covington, VA. A 29-mile short option, and a 53-mile long option both include a 5-mile section of the crushed-gravel Jackson River Scenic Trail (regular road bikes will do fine - 700x25c tires or wider are recommended). The longer ride includes the gravel climb of Little Switzerland Mountain (which may also be avoided). 

No chip timing or results, just fun, great scenery and food and beverage at the finish. Stay an extra night in the Alleghany Highlands, and enjoy the peaceful, low traffic, scenic roads around beautiful Lake Moomaw!
course:
Long: 53 miles, 4744 ft. of climbing, with 41.3 miles of paved roads, 11.8 miles (29%) of gravel roads and one Category 2 climb (Little Switzerland)
 

Short: 29 miles, 2721 ft. of climbing, with 21.5 miles of paved roads and 7.7 miles (26%) of finely crushed gravel trail.
directions:
From Exit 16 on I-64: Take U.S. 220 North through the City of Covington. After 5 miles, urn slight left onto Jackson River Rd/VA-687. Continue to follow Jackson River Rd.
Then after 11.32 miles Jackson River Rd becomes Jackson River Turnpike.
Then 2.45 miles
Turn sharp left onto Coles Mountain Rd/VA-605.
Continue on Coles Mountain Rd. over Gathright Dam and to Coles Point Picnic Area for registration and parking.

Then 1.08 miles
Turn left to stay on Coles Mountain Rd/VA-605.

title: Tour de Tysons
course: 1.1 mile counterclockwise loop with big-ring uphill finish. Same course used 1996-2013
notes:
Racing Notes

No warming up or cooling down on course: bring a trainer. Please be considerate of our hosts. NCVC has zero tolerance for public urination, obstruction of traffic, and obscenity.
Each race will be run as a timed event, rather than by distance.
W1/2/3/4 race run as a single-event with a single prize list.
Unlicensed riders (Cat 5 men, Cat 4 women) must also purchase a one-day license, and may only enter the Category 5 and Women Category 4 races respectively.
Late fee: $10 on race day.
Second race: $10 (show your bib number) No need to pre-register for a second race. If you want to pre-register for a second race, you pay full-fee--leave some spots for others!
Registration opens 6:45 AM and closes 15 minutes before each race.
Race-day registration is available; a $10 late fee will apply to registration fee to adult (only) races ($40 total fee). 
Checks (made out to NCVC), credit cards, and cash will be accepted for registration payment on race day.
Absolutely no buying, selling, or swapping of registrations.
Refunds at the discretion of the promoter.
Entry fees do not include any applicable BikeReg.com fees
Entry fee includes $1 MABRA fee and $3.75 USACycling insurance fee. 
MABRA BAR

MABRA BAR races for this event are
Race: BAR Class
Junior 15-18 : Junior 17-18 Boys and Junior 17-18 Girls
Junior 13-14 : Junior 13-14 Boys and Junior 13-14 Girls
Junior 09-12 : Junior 11-12 Boys and Junior 11-12 Girls
Master 45+ Category 1/2/3/4 :  Masters Men 45+
Category 4 : Men Category 4
Pro1/2/3 : Men 123
Category 3/4 : Men Category 3
Women Category 4: Women 4
Women Category 1/2/3/4 : Women 123
the following fields do not score toward the BAR
Category 5
directions:
GPS coordinates: 38.927088, -77.221500

Address:  1599 Westbranch Dr., Tysons, VA 22102
Driving directions

From I495/Capital Beltway, exit on Rt 123/Dolley MadisonBlvd South. (towards Vienna)
Turn RIGHT onto Tyson's Blvd (as if going to Tyson's II Shopping Mall).
Turn RIGHT onto West Park Dr. Follow course around CCW to parking areas 
Follow course-marshal directions for parking. Park only in the designated parking areas. Do not park at Tysons II.

title: Culpeper Gran Fondo
description:
The Culpeper Gran Fondo began in 2015 with rave reviews, in 2016 it will kick off our Culpeper Endurance Festival with 32, 62 and 100 mile options.  Join your fellow cyclists on low traffic, country roads that wind through horse country, farmland, forests, trout streams and vineyards all within sight of the Blue Ridge Mountains.  Each distance is fully supported with mechanics and well stocked aid stations. All rides start at 7:30am with a mass start.  None of these rides are flat, this is central Virginia, but these rides are gorgeous and fun.  The post ride party starts at 10:30am and goes until 4:00pm.

All registered cyclists get the following: Finishers gift, short sleeve tri-blend shirt, custom ride socks, well supported and well stocked stations on the route and access to the post ride party with BBQ and ice cold refreshments.

title: Training Expedition
description: Created in response to the request of 'Fondo participants, this road cycling event will help ready riders for the Alpine Loop, Shenandoah Mountain Adventure and Shenandoah Mountain Century routes of the 2016 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo.
course:
Riders who are training for the Alpine Loop should be prepared to ride 71 miles with 7,000+ feet of climbing - one of the mountain climbs is on unpaved steep surfaces. The Route includes the "Dark Side" climb up Shenandoah Mountain from the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. Exact route will be e-mailed prior to the ride. (Time-dependant, an additional 10-miles for those who want to push it on some extra climbs).

Riders who are training for the Shenandoah Mountain Adventure should be prepared for a 61-mile ride with 6,000-feet of climbing on paved mountain climbs. Route will include the climb up Shenandoah Mountain's Moyers Gap Road from the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. Exact route will be e-mailed prior to the ride.

After a warmup through the Valley, the ride will make its way up some great mountain roads. The first climb will treat participants to spectacular scenery. We will divide into two groups which will be based on participants' desired ride length; and ultimate training goals: the Alpine Loop, Shenandoah Mountain Century or Shenandoah Mountain Adventure. Throughout the ride, you'll have access to full support from SAG vehicles and enjoy the guidance and expertise of local cycling pro's and seasoned Alpine guides.
registration: Registration closes Wednesday, August 17, 2016 at 5 p.m.
notes: Full details of the training ride including start location, route maps with GPS files will be e-mailed to you in a follow-up message approximately two weeks before the ride.
directions: Harrisonburg location to be e-mailed in registration confirmation

title: 2016 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo
description:
Jeremiah Bishop's 2016 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo Presented by Prostate Cancer Awareness Project
Sunday, September 25, 2016 - Harrisonburg, Virginia
This event operates under special use permit from the USDA Forest Service, North River Ranger District

Hosted by professional cyclist Jeremiah Bishop, the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo is an event to welcome cyclists and spectators to Harrisonburg, Virginia for an exciting weekend of special events, challenging rides, charity fundraising and festivities for the entire family. 

For the latest and most complete event information, visit AlpineLoopGranFondo.com

ENTRY INCLUDES:
107, 100, 78, 62 and 36-MILE ROUTE OPTIONS
HIGH-QUALITY EVENT T-SHIRT *MUST REGISTER BY SEPTEMBER 12 TO GUARANTEE
FULLY STOCKED REST STOPS with HYDRATION STATIONS (DETAILS)
FULLY CATERED MEAL & FINISH LINE FESTIVAL
FIRST BEVERAGE IN BEER GARDEN FOR NO ADDITIONAL COST (MUST BE 21+ BRING ID)
LIVE MUSIC
ELECTRONIC TIMING START-TO-FINISH, KOM SEGMENTS
5-YEAR AGE GROUP KOM/QOM COMPETITION (107, 100/78-MILE ROUTES)
PROSTATE CANCER AWARENESS PROJECT KOM JERSEYS TO 5-YEAR AGE GROUP WINNERS
FREE HOT SHOWERS AT FINISH LINE
FREE ON-SITE PARKING
PREMIUM FINISHER MEDALLIONS

Specatators and family members can purchase optional Finish Line Festival Meal Ticket to access catering - in advance only. All cycling participants will recieve one complimentary beverage ticket that can be redeemed in the Beer Garden. Additional alcoholic beverages can be purchased onsite with cash. Beer Garden to support the Shenandoah Valley Bicycle Coalition.
course:
Mountain Climbs Worthy of a Grand Tour, with the Character and Grit of a Classic
The Most Challenging Gran Fondo in the States!

Jeremiah Bishop nicknamed his favorite training route "The Alpine Loop" after the glorious mountain top meadows, winding climbs and hillside farms reminiscent of the Austrian, German and Swiss settings where he has competed. Now this magnificent scenery is the backdrop for the most challenging and adventurous Gran Fondo in the United States. The route begins in Harrisonburg, Virginia and covers approximately 107 miles featuring over 11,000 feet of climbing, including a gruely dirt climb up the Dark Side of Reddish Knob! Visit AlpineLoopGranFondo.com/routes to learn more. The Alpine Loop route is not recommended for riders who are aiming to complete a "century" ride or those who do not have prior experience riding on unpaved roads or major mountain descents.

Something Fun for Everyone!

The Shenandoah Mountain Century, Shenandoah Mountain Adventure, and Valley View Challenge options encourage and challenge cyclists of all abilities to join in the festivities of the Gran Fondo. At 100, 78 and 36 miles, these courses showcase the ideal scenery that make Harrisonburg and Rockingham County, Virginia and Pendleton County, West Virginia famed riding destinations. Not sure which ride is for you? Visit AlpineLoopGranFondo.com/routes to learn more, including any changes in store for the 2016 event.
notes:
No refunds will be issued. No rain date; In the event of EXTREME weather, routes and milage may be adjusted by promoter. Riders can transfer entries to other riders; requests must be made by contacting organizer prior to September 22.

*Riders under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. 

Mailed Registration must be postmarked by September 14, 2016. Mail Registrations, Payments and Sponsorships to: Bishop Racing LLC, P.O. Box 868, Harrisonburg, Virginia, 22803

Information about Host Hotel and Lodging Discounts is available at AlpineLoopGranFondo.com.
directions:
Directions to Downtown Harrisonburg, Virginia, 22801:

From the North/South: Take Interstate-81 to exit 247B. Merge onto Route 33 West/Market Street toward Harrisonburg. Go 1.7 miles. 

Event-day parking - WILL BE ALLOWED for Gran Fondo participants in the flat municipal lot adjacent to the Start/Finish area and Turner Pavilion. Additional parking will be available in the upper level of the municipal parking deck on Water Street. Parking IS ALLOWED on both sides of Liberty Street south of Warren Street; in the Daily News Record parking lot on Liberty Street - directly across from the Start/Finish Line; on both sides of Main Street between Paul Street and Campbell Street - refer to posted street signs. A parking map will be available at www.AlpineLoopGranFondo.com

title: Bennett's Creek CX - part of the VACX Series
Mapleworks Coaching 2016 Pre-Nats Clinic
description: Mapleworks Coaching and Haymarket Bicycles are hosting your last chance to dial in your speed and equipment for Cyclocross Nationals. Combining brief information sessions and two short “race” simulations, it’s the perfect way to avoid entering Nationals on stale fitness. Information sessions will allow for question and answer sessions from National Champion coaches and winners on topics from equipment choice to travel tips for big races. The “race” sessions will be two 25 minutes mass-start events on cyclocross specific courses.
course:
James Long Regional Park 
4603 James Madison Highway
Haymarket, VA 20169
notes: Anyone racing at nationals that wants to get a good tune-up in, get some inside tips on prep, or anyone wanting to get one last ride in on the cyclocross bike in 2016.
directions: Just north of 66, off James Madison Highway
